Over the last few weeks this bill has unfortunately turned partisan. This is at the detriment of our service members. 

The Senate’s version passed by an 86-8 vote. 

I hope we can make progress on this bill and reach a similar agreement — for the good of our troops.

Speaking now with @HouseGOP on the 2020 #NDAA. 

This bill is totally insufficient to give our military the tools they need to complete their missions. 

We can do better. pic.twitter.com/PtJEh3T1nD
